page.title: 14Changes, Aston Cantlow Area
page.content: A lot of changes have occurred in the past 45 years,The greatest of which being the closure of the railway which used to run through Great Alne until 1951 or 1952. There was a Blacksmith at Aston Cantlow but that closed down. The Boot Inn on The Mill road was closed in 1961 and has been made into three houses. A lot of new housing estates have been built over the past 45 years,some in place of buildings which have been taken down.Also towards Little Alne a power sub-station has been built.A large works was taken over by the American company Rockwell and is now known as Rockwell Maudslay. Very recently some farmers have grubbed out the hedges to enlarge their fields.
